titleStmt.title: A short cronycle wherin is mencioned all the names of all the kings of England of the mayers, [and] sheriffes of the cytie of Londo[n] of diuers and many notable actes and thi[n]ges done in [the] sith the time of kige henry [the] fourth.

publicationStmt.publisher: In fletestrete, at the signe of the Sonne, by Iohn Byddell,

notesStmt.note: Imprint from colophon; publication date from STC.
Title page has border (McKerrow and Ferguson 29) with Byddell's name in type in sill--STC.
Identified as STC 10021 on UMI microfilm reel 61.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

keywords.term: Great Britain -- History -- Chronology -- Early works to 1800.

revisionDesc.change: 2012-07 SPi GlobalKeyed and coded from ProQuest page images
2012-09 Colm MacCrossanText and markup reviewed and edited

div.p: A ſhort cronycle, wherin is mencioned all the names of all the kingꝭ of England of the mayers, & ſhiriffes of the cytie of Londō: & of diuers and many notable actes and thīges done, in, & ſith the time of kīge Henry ye fourth.

figure.figDesc: printer's device of John Bydell, featuring a compartment exhibiting the seven cardinal virtues, wiht Bydell's mark and name below (McKerrow 85)
figure.head: Iohn̄ Byddell.

div.head: ¶To know whan the foure termes of the yere begyn and ende.
div.p: The terme nexte after the Natiuitie of our lorde, begynneth the .xxiiii daye of Ianuary, and endeth the .xii. daye of Februarye.
Eaſter terme begynneth the thyrd day after the quindecim of eaſter, and endeth the fourth daye after the Aſſencion of our lorde.
Mydſomer terme begynneth the thyrde daye after the Octaues of the Trinitie, & endeth the .xi. day of Iulye.
Myghelmas terme beginneth the .ix. daye of October, and endeth the .xxviii. daye of Nouembre.

div.head: Henry the iiij.th
div.p: HEnry the fourth, ſonne to Iohn of Gaunte late Duke of Lancaſtre, and thyrde, ſonne of Edwarde the thyrde, toke poſſeſſion of this realme of Englande the laſte day of September, in the yere of our lord god a .M.CCC, lxxxxix,
Anno. dn̄i. M.ccc, lxxxxix. Anno. H. iiii Thomas knolles Grocer, mayre. Wyllylyam Hyde. Iohn walderne, Shiriffes. ¶In this yere dyed kynge rycharde the ſeconde.

¶In this yere dyuers dukes & erles of Englande, & other were accorded to make a mūmyng on twelfe daye at nyght, trayterouſly to kylle the kinge, than beyng at wyndſore, whiche beinge warned therof departed ſodenlye & came to London, and made purſute after the ſaid cōſpiratours whiche apprehended and taken, were after
by the order of the lawe put to death. ¶In this yere was enacted by auctorytye of parliament, that no lorde, nor other mā myght gyue any gownes or lyuecyes to any of their tenauntes, or other ꝑſons, except onely theyr houſholde & meynyal ſeruauntes.

¶In this yere was alſo enacted, that al repyers & other fyſhers from Rye, wyncheſſee, & other coſtes of the ſee ſyde, ſhold ſell theyr fyſſhe them ſelfe, in Cornhyll, Chepe, and other ſtretes of London, to al men that wolde by of them fiſſhmongers and all other that wolde by ye ſayd fiſſhe to make ſale agayne of it, onely except.
Anno. dn̄i. M.CCCC. Anno. ij. H. iiii. Iohn̄ Fraunces Goldſmyth, mayre. Iohn̄ wakele, William Ebot, ſhirifs. ¶This yere a pryour & .viii. treers were hanged at tyburne for treaſon.
Anno. do. M.cccc.i. Anno. iij. Henr. iiii. Iohn̄ Shadworth mayre, William Fremyngham. William Venour, Shiriffes.
Anno. dn̄i. M.cccc.ii. Anno. iiii. H. iiii. Iohn̄ Walcot, mayre, Roberte Chicheley Rycharde Marlow, ſhirifs.
¶The battayle of Shrowyſbury.
Anno do. M.cccc.iii. Anno. v. Henr. iiii. William Aſkham mayre, Thomas Fawkener, Thomas Poole, ſhirifs
Anno. do. M.cccc.iiii. Anno. vi. Hen. iiii Iohn Hynde draper mayre, William Lowth Stephan Spylman, Sheriffes ¶In this yere Scrope archebyſſhop of yorke was beheded for treaſon.
Anno. dn̄i. M.cccc.v. Anno. vii. Hen. iiii Iohn̄ Woodcocke mayre, Henry Barton William Crowner Shirifs.
Anno. do. M.cccc.vi. Anno. viii, Hen. iiii Richarde whityngton Mercer mayre. Nycolas Wotton, Geffrey broke ſhirifs.
Anno. dn̄i. M.cccc. vii. Anno. ix. H. iiii. William Standon grocer mayre, Henrye Halton, Henry Ponfret, ſhirifs.
Anno. do. M.cccc.viii. Anno. x. H. iiii. Drewe Barencyne Goldſmythe mayre. Thomas Duke. William Norton. ſhir.
Anno. do. M.cccc.ix. Anno. xi. Henr. iiii. Rycharde Marlow yrenmonger mayre. Iohn Hawe. William Chicheley. ſhirifs.

Anno. do. M.cccc.x. Anno. xii. Hen. iiii. Thomas Knolles grocer Mayre. Iohn Pe • ne. Thomas Pyke. Shiriffes. ¶This yere was abyll put into the parliament agaynſt the ſpiritualtye, for wā ſtynge othe temporaltyes.
Anno. do. M.cccc.xi. Anno. xiii. H, iiii. Robert Chicheley grocer mayre. Iohn Reynwell. Walter Cotton, ſhirifs.

Anno. do. M.cccc.xii. Anno. xiiii. H. iiii. William Walderne mercer mayre. Raufe Leuyngham, William Seuenok, ſhirifs ¶The ſayd kyng Henry the fourth dyed the .xx. day of marche, in the ſayde yere of
our lord. M.cccc.xii. whan he had regned xiii. yeres .v. monethes, and .xxi. dayes, & is buryed at Canterbury,

div.head: Henry the fyfthe.
div.p: HEnry ye fyfth began his reygne the xxi. daye of Marche, in the yere of our lorde nexte aboue mencioned, & was crowned at weſtminſter the .ix. daye of Aprill folowynge, in the yere of our lorde god a. M.cccc.xiii.
Anno. dn̄i. M.cccc.xiiii. Anno. i. Hen. v. William Walderne mercer mayre. Raufe Leuyngham. William Seuenoke Shir
Anno. dn̄i. M.cccc.xxiiii. Anno. ii. Hen. v. William Crowner draper mayre. Iohn Sutton Iohn Mycoll. ſhirifs.

Anno. do. M.cccc.xv. Anno. iiii. Henr. v, Thomas Fawkener mercer mayre.
Iohn̄ Mychell. Thomas Aleyn, ſhirifs. ¶The batayle of Agyncourte.
Anno. dn̄i. M.cccc.xvi. Anno. iiii. He. v Nicolas Wotton draper, mayre Wylliam Cambrige. Alane Euerade, ſhiriffes
Anno. dn̄i. M.cccc.xvii. Anno. v, Hen. v Henry Barton ſkynner mayre. Robert Whitington. Iohn Couentre, ſhiriffes.
Anno. dn̄i. M.cccc.xviii. Anno. vi. H. v. Rycharde Marlowe yrenmonger mayre. Henry Rede. Iohn̄ Gedney, ſhirifs
¶This yere ſyr Iohn̄ Oldcaſtel knyght lorde Cobham was hanged in cheynes & after brent.
Anno do. M.cccc.xix. Anno. vii. Hen. v William Seuenok grocer mayre. Iohn̄ Parnes. Rauf Barton. Iohn̄ Brian, ſhir.
Anno dn̄i. M.cccc.xx. Anno. viii. Hen. v Rycharde Whitingham mercer, mayre. Roberte Whitingham. Iohn Butler. ſhir
Anno. do M.cccc.xxi. Anno. Hen. v. William Cambrige grocer mayre, Iohn̄ Butler. William Weſton, ſhirifs ¶The byrth of Henry the ſyxthe.

Anno. dn̄i. M.cccc.xxii, Anno. x. Hen. v Robert Chicheley grocer mayre. Rycharde Ioſielyn. William weſton ſhir. ¶The ſayde kyng Henrye the fyfte dyed the .xxi. day of Auguſt. in the yere of oure lorde next aboue mencioned, whan he had reigned .ix. yeres .v. monethes and .xxiiii. dayes, and lyeth buryed at Weſtmynſter.

div.head: Henry the ſyxth.
div.p:
HEnry the ſyxth began his reygne the fyrſt day of September, in the yere of our lorde next aboue mecyoned, & was crowned at weſtmynſter in the .viii. yere of his reygne, all whiche tyme before, for infuffiency of age, he was commytted to the rule of his vncles, the dukes of Bedford
& of Glouceſtre, he was of the age of viii. monethes & odde dayes, & not aboue.
Anno. do. M.cccc.xxiii. Anno. i. Henr. vi William Walderne, mayre, William Eſtfelde. Roberte Taterſale, ſhirifs.

Anno do. M.cccc.xiiii. Anno. ii. Hen. vi. William crowner draper mayre. Nycolas Iames. Thomas Wadeforde, ſhirifs ¶In this yere the duke of Bedforde Regent of fraunce, made war vpon the Dolphin of Fraunce, & to thengliſhmen ferthe vyctorye, at the batayle of Vernoyle.
Anno. do. M.cccc.xv. Anno. iii. Henr. vi Iohn̄ Mychel, mayre. Symonde Seman. Iohn Bithwater, ſhiriffes.
Anno. do. M.cccc.xxvi. Anno. v. Hen. vi Iohn Couentre Mercer mayre. William Milrede. Iohn Brokle, ſhirifs.
Anno. do. M.cccc.xxvii. Anno. v. H. vi. Iohn Raynwell fyſſhmonger mayre. Robert Arnolde. Iohn Higham ſhirifs.
Anno. do. M.cccc.xxviii. Anno. vi. H. vi. Iohn Gedney draper mayre. Robert Otly. Henry Frowike ſhirifs.
Anno do. M.cccc.xxix. Anno. vii. H. vi Henry • a • ton ſkynner, mayre. Thomas Daſhous. Rauf Holand, ſhir,
Anno. do. M.cccc.xxx. Anno. viii. H. vi. William Eſtfelde mercer mayre. Wyllyam Ruife. Ruffe hollonde, ſhirifs. ¶In this .vii. yere kynge Henry the .vi. was crowned at weſtminſter.
Anno do. M.cccc.xxxi. Anno. ix. Hen. vi. Nicolas Wotton mayre. Walter Che •• ſey. Robart Large, ſhirifs.

Anno. do. M.cccc.xxxii. Anno. x. H. vi Iohn Weiley grocer mayre Iohn Ad • r • ee. Stephan Browne, ſhirifs ¶In this tenth yere kynge Henrye the ſixth was crowned at Parys, whiche is the chef. Cytye of all Fraunce.
Anno. dn̄i. M.cccc.xxxiii. Anno. xi. H. vi Iohn̄ Parneys fyſſhmonger, mayre Iohn̄ Olney, Iohn̄ Paddiſley, ſhirifs.
Anno. dn̄i. M.cccc.xxxiii. An. xii. H. vi. Iohn̄ Brokeley draper mayre.
Thomas Chalton, Iohn̄ Linge, ſhirifs.
Anno do. M.cccc.xxxv. Anno. xiii. H. vi Roberte Otley grocer mayre.
Thomas bernwell, Symonde Eyre. ſhir

¶In this yere was a greate froſt, that endured from the feaſt of ſaynt Katherin vnto the feaſt of ſaynt Valentyne, ſo that neyther ſhyp myght ſayle, nor boote be rowed in the Ryuer of Thames, & therfore al the vyntage was caryed to London by lande in Cartes.
An do. M.cccc.xxxvi. Anno. xiiii. H. vi. Henry Frowyke mercer mayre, Thomas Catworth. Robert Clopton, ſhirifs.
An. do. M.cccc.xxxvii. Anno. xv. H. vi. Iohn̄ Mychell, mayre. Thomas Morſted, William Gregory, ſhirifs.
Anno. M.cccc.xxxviij. Anno. xvi. H. vi. William Eſtfelde mercer mayre. William Chapman, William halis, ſhir.
Anno. do. M cccc.xxxix. Anno. xvij. H. vi Stephan Browne grocer, mayre. Hugh Dyke. Nycolas yeo, ſhirifs.
Anno. dn̄i, M.cccc.xl. Anno. xviij. H. vi Roberte large mercer mayre. Roberte Marſhall Philip Malpas ſherifs.
Anno. dn̄i. M.cccc.xli. Anno. xix. H. vi. Iohn̄ Paddyſley goldſmyth, mayre Iohn̄ Dutton, William wetinghale, ſhir
Anno. dn̄i. M.cccc.xlii. Anno. xx. H. vi. Robert Clopton mayre, William Combes, Richarde Eiche, ſherifs.
¶This yere the ſteple of paules church in London was ſet on fyre by lyghtening
Anno do, M.cccc.xliii. Anno. xxi. H. vi. Iohn̄ Atherley yrēmonger, mayre. Thomas Beumoūt, Rycharde Nordon, ſhir.
Anno. do. M.cccc.xliii. Anno. xxii. H. vi, Thomas Catworth grocer mayer. Nycolas Wyforde. Iohn̄ Norman, ſhir.
Anno. do. M.cccc.xlv. Anno. xxiii. H. vi Henry frowyke mercer, mayre,
Stephan foſter. Hugh wyche, ſhirifs,
¶In this yere Margarete the kynges doughter of Cecile, was maryed to the kinge, & after crowded at weſtmynſter.
Anno. do. M.cccc.xlvi. Anno. xxiiii. H. vi Iohn̄ Olney mercer, mayre Iohn̄ Herne. Godfrey Baleyne, ſhiriffes
Anno. do. M.cccc.xlvii. Anno. xxv. H. vi. Iohn Gedney draper mayre. William Abraham. Thomas Scot ſhir. ¶This yere dyed the good duke of Glouceſtre and is buryed at ſaynt Albanes.
An. do. M.cccc.xlviii. Anno. xxvi. H. vi Stephan browne grocer mayre. Wyllyam Cantlowe. William Marow, ſhir.
Anno. do. M.cccc.xlix. Anno. xxvii. H. vi. Thomas Chalton mayre. Thomas Caninges. William Howlin, ſherifs.
¶In this yere the comons of kent aroſe and made them a capteyne named Iacke Cade, which dyd moch harme.
Anno. do. M.cccc.l. Anno. xxviij.i. H. vi Nycolas wyforde grocer mayre, William Dere. Iohn̄ Mydelton, ſhir.
Anno. do. M.cccc.li. Anno. xxix. H. vi. William Gregory ſkinner mayre. Mathew Philip. Chriſtofer Warton ſhirifs.
Anno. do. M.cccc.lii. Anno. xxx. Hen. vi. Godfrey Feldinge, mayre.
Rycharde Lee. Rycharde Alley, ſhirifs.
¶A metinge of a great hooſt vpon brent heth in kent, bytwene the kynge and the duke of yorke.
Anno. do. M.cccc.liii. Anno. xxxi. H. vi. Iohn̄ Norman draper mayre.
Iohn̄ Walden. Thomas Coke, ſheriffes.
Anno. do. M.cccc.liiij. Anno. xxxii. H. vi Stephan Foſter mayre.
William Tayloure. Iohn Felde ſhiriffes.
¶This yere was the firſte battayle at ſaynte Albanes.
Anno. do. M.cccc.lv. Anno. xxxiij. H. vi. William Marow grocer, mayre
Iohn̄ yonge, Thomas Olgraue, ſhirifs.
Anno. do. M.cccc.lvi. Anno. xxxiiii. H. vi Thomas Ca • inges, mayre.
Iohn Stewarde Raufe Verney, ſhirifs,
Anno. do. M.cccc.lvii. Anno. xxxv. H vi Godfrey Boleyn mercer: mayre. William Edwarde. Thomas Reyner, ſhirifs.
¶In this yere the ſcience of printinge fyrſte began in Almayne, at the Cytye of Magunce.
Anno. M.cccc.lviii. Anno. xxxvi. H. vi. Thomas Scot draper, mayre.
Rauf Ioſſelyn, Richarde Nedeham ſhir. ¶This yere was ye batayle of blore heth
Anno do. M.cccc.lix. Anno. xxxvii. H. vi, William Hulin fiſſhmonger mayre.
Iohn̄. Stocker. Iohn̄ plummer, ſhirifs.
¶The battayle at Northampton.
Anno do. M.cccc.lx. Anno. xxxviii. H. vi. Rycharde Leegrocer mayre. Iohn̄ Lambert. Richarde Flemynge, ſhirifs.
¶In this yere was ye duke of york made heyre apparraunt.
¶The battayle at Wakefelde.
¶The ſecond battaile at ſaynt Albanes.

¶The fourth daye of March, in the yere of oure lorde. M.cccc.lx. and in the .xxxix. yere of the reigne of kinge Henry the ſixth kinge Edwarde the fourth toke firſt poſſeſſion in this realme, and the .xxviii. daye of Iune, in the yere of oure lorde. M.cccc.lxi. the ſame kinge Edwarde was crowned at weſtmynſter, and in the ſame yere that is to ſaye, the nynthe daye of Iulye than nexte folowinge, was the battayle of Northampton.

div.head: Edward the iiij.th
div.p: Anno do. M.cccc.lxi. Anno. i. Edw. iiii. Hugh Wiche, mayre,
George Irelonde. Iohn̄ Locke. ſhirifs.
¶In this yere vpon palme ſonday was the battayle called yorke felde.
Anno do. M.cccc.lxii. Anno. ii. Ed. iiii. Thomas Cooke mayre. Barthum Iames. William hampton, ſhiriffes.
¶This yere was ye battayle at Exham
Anno do. M.cccc.lxiii. Anno. iii. Ed. iiii. Mathew Philip goldſmyth, mayre, Thomas Muſchāp. Robert Baſſet, ſhir.
Anno do. M.cccc.lxiiii. Anno. iiii. Ed. iiii Raufe Ioſſelyn draper mayre
Iohn̄ Tate. Iohn̄. Stone, Shirifs. ¶This yere was kyng Edward maried
Anno do. M.cccc.lxv. Anno. v. Ed. iiij. Raufe Verney mercer mayre.
Henry Wauyr. Willyam Conſtanſtine, ſhir
Anno. do. M.cccc.lxvi. Anno. vi. Ed. iiii Iohn̄ yonge grocer knight mayre. Iohn̄ bryce. Iohn̄ Browne. Iohn̄ ſtokton, ſhir.
Anno. do. M.cccc.lxvii. Anno. vii. Ed. iiii Thomas Owlgraue, mayre. Humfreye Heyforde. Thomas Stalbroke, ſhiriffes.
Anno dn̄i. M.cccc.lxviii. An. viii. E. iiii William Taylour grocer mayre, Symon Smith. William Haryot. ſhir.
Ann do. M.cccc.lxix. Anno. ix. Ed. iiii. Rycharde Lee grocer mayre. Robert Drope. Rycharde Gardener, ſhir.
¶In this yere was the lorde Ryuers taken and beheded.
¶In this yere alſo was the lord welles beheded.
¶In this yere was ye battayle of Egecot beſyde banbury.
¶In this yere the duke of Clarence, and the erle of warwycke fled ouer the ſee.

¶In this yere kynge Henry the .vi. was
agayne reſtored to the crowne.
¶In this yere was the erle of Worceſter beheded.

Anno do. M.cccc.lxx. Anno. x. Ed. iiii. Iohn̄. Stokton mercer knyght mayre. Iohn̄ Croſbye, Iohn̄ Warde Shiriffes. ¶In this yere the duke of Clarence landed at Dertmouth with the erles of warwike of Penbroke & Oxforde, & with many other gentylmen.
¶This yere kinge Edward fled ouer the ſee.
¶In this yere was kynge Henry againe proclaymed kinge.
¶In this yere quene Elyzabeth at Weſtmynſter was delyuered of a yonge prince named Edwarde.
¶In this yere were kyng Edward and the Duke of Glouceſtre attaynedas traytours, and kinge Edwarde proclaymed vſurper of the Crowne.

¶In this yere kinge Edwarde landed in the North, at a place called Rauynſpore.
with a ſmall company of flemynges.
¶In this yere was king Henry the ſixth taken by kynge Edwarde the fourth, in ye byſſhops palays at Paules in London. ¶In this yere was Bernet felde.
Anno. do. M.cccc.lxxi. Anno. xi. Ed. iiii. William Edwarde grocer, mayre.
Iohn̄ Aleyne, Iohn̄ Chelley, ſhirifs.
¶In this yere kyng Edward the fourth began agayne his dominion ouer the realme of Englande.
¶The battayle at Tewkeſbury.
¶This yere dyed kynge Henry the ſixte.
Anno do. M.cccc lxxii. Anno. xii. Ed. iiii. Wyllyam hamptō fiſſhmonger mayre. Thomas Bledlow, Iohn̄ browne, ſhirifs
Anno M.cccc.lxxiii. Anno. xiii. Ed. iiii. Iohn̄ Tate mercer mayre, William Stocker. Robert Bylleſdon, ſhirifs.
Anno M.cccc.lxxiiii. An. xiiii. Ed. iiii. Roberte Drope draper mayre.
Edmunde Shaa. Thomas Hyll, ſhirifs. ¶In this yere kinge Edwarde made a voyage into Fraunce.
Anno do. M.cccc.lxxv. Anno. xv. Ed. iiij Robert Baſſet ſalter, mayre.
Robert Coſwyche. Hugh Bryce, ſhiriffes. ¶In this yere were dyuerſe bakers of London ſet vpon the pyllory, for makinge of lyght weyght of breade.
Anno do. M.cccc.lxxvi. Anno. xvi. E. iiii. Raufe Ioſſelyne draper, mayre.
Rycharde Rawſon. William. Horne, ſhir. ¶In this yere from Crypylgate to Biſſhops gate, Lōdon wall was newlye repayred.

Anno M.cccc.lxxvii. Anno. xvii. Ed. iiii. Humfreye Heyforde goldſmyth, mayre, Henry Collet. Iohn̄ Stocker, ſhiriffes. ¶In this yere George duke of Clarence yonger brother to kinge Edwarde, beinge pryſoner in the Tower of London, was
there drowned in a barell of maulueſeye.
Anno. M.cccc.lxxviii. Anno. xviii. E. iiii Rycharde Gardyner mercer / mayre.
Robert Hardynge. Robert Byfelde / ſhir. ¶In this yere was great mortalytie in London, & through out all England.
Anno do. M.cccc.lxxix. Anno. xix. Ed. iiii Barthylmewe Iames draper / mayre. Thomas Ilam. Iohn̄ warde. ſhiriffes.
Anno dn̄i. M.cccc.lxxx. Anno xx. Ed. iiii. Iohn̄ Browne / mayre. William Bacon. William Danyell / ſhiriffes.
Anno dn̄i. M.cccc.lxxxi. Anno. xxi. E. iiii William Haryot draper knyght / mayre. Robert Tate. William Wykynge. Rycharde Chawry / ſhiriffes.

¶This yere in the moneth of of Iuly, the kynge ſent for the mayre, with certeyn of his bretherne, and comyners of the City of London, vnto the foreſt of waltham &
there cauſed the game to be broughte before them, ſo that they ſawe courſe after courſe, & many a dere both reed & falowe ſlayne. And after that the kinge cōmaunded his officers to bringe the mayre & his company vnto a pleaſaunt lodge made al of grene bowes, & there ſet them to dyner & ſerued them with many deynty diſſhes and dyuers wynes good & plenty, & ouer that cauſed the lorde chambrelayne, with other lordes, to chere the mayre & his company ſondry tymes whyle they were at dyner, and at theyr departyng gaue vnto them venyſon grate plenty.
¶In this yere alſo the kinge ſente vnto the mayreneſſe of Lōdon and her ſyſters aldermēs wyues, two hartes .vi. buckes and a tunne of wyne, to make them mery withall.

Anno. do. M.cccc.lxxxii. An. xxii. Ed. iiii. Edmunde Shaa goldſmyth mayre. Iohn̄ Mathew. William white, ſhirifs. ¶In this begynnynge of the .xxiii. yere
of the kinge at weſtmynſter, the .ix. daye of Aprill dyed the noble kinge Edward ye fourth, & is buryed at wyndſore, whan he had rigned, to recken his begynnynge out of the lande, with all other tyme, full xxii. yeres, & as moche as from ye fourthe day of Marche, vnto the .ix. daye of Aprill leuynge after him two ſonnes, that is to ſaye prince Edwarde his eldeſt ſonne, & Rycharde duke of yorke, & thre doughters as Elyſabeth that after was quene, Cyceley and Katheryne.

div.head: Edward the fyfte
div.p: EDward the fyfth began his reigne ouer the realme of England the .xi. day of April, in the begynnyng of the yere of our lorde. M.cccc.lxxxiii. the ſame Edward beīg of the age of .xi. yeres, or there aboute This Edwarde was neuer crowned, but ſhamefully murthered by the cō maundemente of Rycharde the thyrde, that after was kinge of Englande.

div.head: Rychard the .iij.
div.p: Rycharde the thyrde began his dominyon ouer the realme of Englande the .xxi. day of Iune, in ye yere of our lord M.CCCC.lxxxiii. and the ſyxt day of Iuly than next folowynge was crowned at weſtmynſter.
Anno. do. M.cccc.lxxxiii. Anno. i. Ry. iii. Robert Bylleſdon haberdaſſher, mayre. Thomas Norland. Williā martyne, ſhir ¶In this yere was the duke of Buckingham beheded at Salyſbury.
Anno do. M.cccc.lxxxiiii. Anno. ii. R. iii. Thomas Hyll mayre. Thomas Breteyn Rycarde Cheſtre Raufe Aſtry. ſhir.

¶The .xxii. day of Auguſt, in the yere of our lord. M.cccc.lxxxv. was the battayle of Boſworth, nere to Leyceſtre, in ye whiche kynge Rycharde the thyrde, in the thyrde yere of his reygne was ſlayne by
kinge Henry the ſeuenth, the whiche in ye ſame day began his reigne ouer ye realme of Englande, and the .xxx. day of October than next folowing was crowned at weſt mynſter.

¶In the .xiii. day of September, in the yere of our lorde laſt before mencyoned, of the ſweat dyed the foreſayd Thomas Hil mayre, in whoſe place the .xxiiii. day of ye moneth & yere of our lord, laſt before mencyoned, Williā Stocker knight was choſen mayre which Stocker dyed the xviii. day of the ſayde moneth, alſo of the ſweat & the .xxix. day of ye ſayd moneth, of September was Iohn̄ Warde choſen mayre & ſo contynued vntyll the feaſte of Symō and Iude than next folowynge.

div.head: Henry the ſeuēth
div.p: Anno do. M.cccc.lxxxv. Anno. i. H. vii. Hughe Bryce goldſmyth knight mayre. Iohn̄ Tate, Iohn̄ Swan, Shirifs.
Anno. do. M.cccc.lxxviii. An. ii. H. vii. Henry Collet mercer knight mayre.
Iohn percyuale. Hugh Clopton ſhirifs. ¶In this yere the kinge maryed kynge Edwardes eldeſt doughter, named Elyzabeth, & in the moneth of Septembre next after was prince Arthur borne at Wyncheſtre.
Anno. M.cccc.lxxxvii. Anno. iii. H. vii. Wylliam Horne mayre. Wylliam Remyngton, Iohn̄ Fenkyll ſhirifs.
¶This yere on ſaynte Katheryns daye was the quene crowned at weſtmynſter.
Anno. M.cccc.lxxxviii. Anno. iiii. H. vii Robert Tate mercer mayre,

Wyllyam Iſaac. Raufe Tylney, ſhirifs. ¶In this yere the cōmons of the North ſlew the erle of Northumberland, & in the ſame yere was the felde of Dykeſmew in Flaūders foughten by ye lord Dawbeney where the lorde Morley was ſleyne. Anno. dn̄i. M.cccc.lxxxix. Anno. v. Hē. vii.
William white mayre.
Wylliam Capell. Iohn̄ Broke ſhirifs.
Anno do. M.cccc.lxxxx. Anno. vi. H. vii. Iohn̄ Mathew mercer mayre. Hēry Cote Robert Reuel, Hugh Pemberton, ſhirifs. ¶This yere was lorde Henry the kinges ſeconde ſon borne at Grenewich in Iune.
Anno do. M.cccc.lxxxxi. Anno. vii. H. vii Hugh Clopton mercer mayre.
Thomas wode, William browne. ſhir.
Anno do. M.cccc.lxxxxii. Anno. viii. H. vii William Martyne ſkynner mayre.
William purchaſe, Wylliam welbeke, ſhir ¶This yere in the monethe of October was a fraye made vpon the Eſterlynges by the commons of the City of London, & ſpecyally by mercers ſeruauntes.
Anno M.cccc.lxxxxiii. Anno. ix. H. vii. Raufe Aſtry fyſſhmonger mayre. Robert Fabyan, Wyllyam, Wyngar, ſhir.
¶In this yere was wheate at .vi. d. the buſſhell, & bay ſalte at .iii. d. ob. a buſſhell in the cytye of London.
¶Syr wyllyam Stanley beheded.
Anno do. M.cccc.lxxxxiiii.. Anno. x. H. vii Rychard Chawry ſalter mayre,
Nycolas alwyn, Iohn Warner ſhirifes. ¶In this yere in London were whyte heryng ſolde for thre ſhyllinges. iiii. d a barell & not aboue.
Anno M.cccc.lxxxxv. Anno. xi. H. vii. Henry Collet mercer knyght, mayre. Thomas kneyſworth Henry Somyr Shir.
Anno. M.cccc.lxxxxvi. Anno. xii. H. vii Iohn̄ & are mercer mayre.
Iohn̄ Shaa, Rychard Haddon ſhirifs. ¶I this yere the .xvii. day of Iune was Blakheth felde.

Anno. M.cccc.lxxxxvii. Anno. xiii. H. vii. Wyllyam Purchaſe mercer mayre.
Bartylmewe Rede. Tho. wyndoute, ſhir.
Anno M.cccc.lxxxxviii. Anno. xiiii. H. vii. Iohn̄ Percyuale marchaunt Tayloure. mayre. Thomas Bradburye. Stephan Ienyns, ſherifs.
Anno. M.cccc.lxxxxix. Anno. xv. H. vii. Nycolas Alwyn, mayre. Iames. Wilforde. Rycharde Bronde, ſhirifs.
Anno do. M.ccccc. Anno. xvi. Henry. vii. Wyllyam Remyngton, mayre.
Iohn̄ hawes wyllyam Stede ſhirifs. ¶In this yere the .iiii. daye of October, landed at Plymmouth Katherin doughter of the kynge of Spayne.
Anno. do. M.ccccc.i. Anno. xviii. H. vii. Iohn̄ Shaa goldſmith, mayre.
Laurence Aylemer, Henry Hede, ſhirifs. ¶In this yere vpon ſaynt Erkenwaldes daye, was prince Arthur maryed to the foreſayde lady Katherin.

Anno do. M.ccccc.ii. Anno. xviii. H. vii. Bartylmew Rede goldſmyth mayre. Henry Keybell. Nycolas Nynys ſhirifs. ¶In this yere the .xi. daye of Februarye dyed quene Elyzabeth in ye tower of London lyinge in chyldbed. And the .viii. day of Auguſt was ye kīg of Scottes maried to Margarete eldeſt doughter of the king
Anno do. M.ccccc.iii. Anno. xix. H. vii. William Capell draper mayre.
Xp̄ofer Hawes Robert Wattes, Thomas Graunger ſhirifs.
Anno. do. M.ccccc.iiii. Anno. xx. H. vii. Iohn̄ Wyngar grocer mayre.
Roger Achylley. William Browne ſhir.

Anno do. M.ccccc.v. Anno. xxi. Hē. vii, Thomas Kneyſworth fyſhmōger mayre Rycharde Shore. Roger Groue, ſhirifs. ¶In this yere was the Wethercocke of Paules blowen downe, and the duke of Burgoyne was dryuen to lād in the Weſt countrey.
Anno do. M.ccccc.vi. Anno. xxii. H. vij. Rycharde Haddō mercer knyght, mayre. Wylliā Copīger, Wylliā Fytzwilliā, ſhyr.
Anno. do. M.ccccc.vii. Anno. xxiii. H. vii. Wyllyam Browne mercer. Laurence Aylmer draper, mayers.
Wylliam Butler. Iohn̄ Kyrkby, ſhirifs. ¶In this ſame yere was a greate parte of the cytye of Norwyche brente.

Anno. M.ccccc.viii. Anno. xxiiii. H. vij. Steph. Genīs marchaūt taylour, mayre. Tho. Exmew. Rycharde Smyth, ſhirifs ¶In this yere the .xxi. daye of Apryll, in the .xxiiii. yere of his reygne, dyed kynge Henry the .vii. at Rychemonde, and was buryed at weſtmynſtre.

OVr moſt gracyous ſoueraygne lorde kyng Henry the .viii. began his moſt gracyous reygne the .xxii. daye of Apryll, in the yere of oure Lorde. M.ccccc.ix. and was crowned at Weſtmynſtre, in the feeſt of the natyuytie of ſaynt Iohn̄ Baptiſt.

div.head: Henry the viiith
div.p: Anno. do. M.ccccc.ix. Anno. j. Henry. viij. Thomas Bradburye mercer mayre, George Monox. Ihon̄ Doket, ſhirifs. ¶Empſon & dudley beheded in Auguſt. Syr William Fitzwilliam diſfranchaſyd bycauſe he wold not be ſhirife.
Anno dn̄i. M.ccccc.x. Anno. ij. Hē. viij. Henry Keybell, mayre.
Iohn̄ Mylborne. Iohn̄ Reſt ſhirifs. ¶Prince Henry borne at Rychemonde on newyers day, & ſolempne Iuſts kept at Weſtmynſter. And on ſaynt Mathewes day the prynce dyed.

Anno dn̄i. M.ccccc.xi. Anno. iii. H. viiij. Roger Achyley draper / mayre. Nycolas Shelton. Thomas Myrfyne, ſhirifs. ¶The lorde Darcy ſent into Spayne to ayde the king of Spayne againſt the Mores but peace was made before his aryuynge & ſo he returned & the ſame ſeaſon
was ſyr Edwarde Pownynges ſent into Gelderland to ayde the prynce of Caſtell & the lorde Haward toke Andrew bortō &c.lx. ſcottes & .ii. fayre ſhyps.
Anno do. M.ccccc.xii. Anno. iiii. H. viii. William Copynger fyſhmōger. Rychard Haddon knyght / mayrs. Roberte Holdernes. Rober Fenrother / ſhiriffes. Edmonde de la poole beheded.

¶This yere the lorde Marques Dorſet was ſent in to Spayne, with .x.M men & dyd moch hurte in Guyon & returned in winter by reaſon of the flix, & on ſent lawrens daye the Regent & the Carycke were brent which were .ii. great ſhyps.
Anno dn̄i. M.ccccc.xiii. Anno. v. H. viij William Browne mercer / mayre

Iohn̄ Dawes. Iohn̄ Bruge / ſhiriffes. ¶The ſayd Dawes dyed wtin ye yere / & in his place was choſen Roger Baſforde. ¶Syr Edwarde Howard lord Admyrall of England was ſlayne on ſaint Markes
daye in Brytayne by to moch hardynes, after in Iune the king beſieged Turwyn & diſcōfited the power of Fraunce at Boomye, & toke the Cytyes of Turwyn and Turney, & returned without any more battayle offered, duryng which tyme the kynge of Scottes enoyed England with a. c.M. men & was ſlayne hym ſelfe & .xj. Erles by therle of Surrey ye kynges lieftenaunt / wherfore the kyng created hym after duke of Norfolke & his ſonne Erle of Surrey.
Anno do. M.ccccc.xiiii. Anno. vj. H. viii. George Monox draper / mayre.

Iamys yarforde. Iohn̄ Mundy / ſhirifs ¶This yere was a peace concluded betwene England and Fraunce, and on S. Denyes day, the Frenche kynge maryed the lady Mary the kinges ſyſter, & he dyed on new yeres day after, & therfore ye kīg ſente for her agayne, by the duke of Suffolke & other. Alſo this yere was Rychard Hunne hanged in the lollars tower.

Anno do M.ccccc.xv. Anno. vij. H. viij.
William Butler grocer / mayre.

Henry Worley. Rycharde Grey / ſhiriffes. ¶The ſayd Grey dyed within the yere & in his place was choſen William Bayly. ¶The quene of ſcottes came to London in Maye and taryed there a hole yere. ¶In Apryll the Frenche quene came in to England & was maryed to lord Charles duke of Suffolke, this yere Margret quene of ſcottes ſyſter to the kynge fled in England & lay at Harbottell & ſhe was delyuered of a doughter called Margrete. And in February was borne the lady Mary the kynges doughter at Grenewyche.

Anno. M.ccccc.xvi. Anno viij. H. viii. Iohn̄ Reſt grocer / mayre. Thomas Seymer. Rycharde Thurſton / ſhiriffes. ¶This yere was ſuch a froſt that all mē with Cartes myght paſſe bytwene weſtmynſtre and Lambeth.

¶On May euen this yere was an inſurrection of yonge perſons agaynſt alyenes of the whiche dyuers were put to execucion
and the other came to weſtmynſter with halters about theyr nekes & were pardoned, and the .xviij. day of Maye the quene of ſcottes returned to her countrey.

Anno. do. M.ccccc.xvij. Anno. ix. H. viii Tho. Exmewe goldſmyth knyght mayre Thomas Baldry, Rychard Symōd, ſhir ¶The terme adiourned to Oxforde & agayne to Londō, in October the admyrall of Fraūce cam into England, & Tourney was delyuered to the Frenche kynge.
Anno do. M.ccccc.xviii. Anno. x. H. viii. Thomas Myrfyn ſkynner mayre.
Iohn Aleyn, Iames Spencer ſhiriffes. ¶In this yere was at Frankford Charles the .v. elected Emperour.
¶And therle of Surrey ſēt in to Irelād.

Anno. do. M.ccccc.xix. Anno. xi. H. viii. Iamys Yarford, mercer knight mayre. Iohn̄. Wilkinſon, Nycolas Patriche ſhir ¶The kyng and the Frenche kynge met at the campe betwene Arde & Guyſnes where were great tryūphes & after the
king & themperour met, & the kyng went to Grauelin with themperour, & themperoure came to Caleys with the kinge and had great chere & the kinge returned.

Anno do. M.ccccc.xx. Anno. xii. H. viij. Iohn̄ Bruge draper, knyght, mayre. Iohn̄ Skeuinton. Iohn̄ kembe ſhirifs. ¶This yere the duke of Buckīghā was beheded ye .xvii. day of May. And in Iune the Cardynall went to Caleys to entreate a peace betwne themperour & the frēche kynge, & taryed there tyl December with out any thynge concluded.

Anno. do. M.ccccc.xxi. Anno. xiii. H. viii. Iohn̄ Mylborne draper / mayre. Iohn̄ Breteyn. Thomas Pergetour / ſhiriffes. ¶In this yere the fryday before Penthecoſt, that is to ſaye, the .vi. daye of Iune / Charles the .v. Emperoure was honorably receyued into the cytye of London, of the Mayre, Aldermen, & comynaltye, our ſayde ſouerayne lorde accompanying, the ſayde emperour: And from Lōdon he wēt
to Wynſore & ſat in his ſtal of the Garter, and from thens went to Hamton, & ſayled into Sayne, duryng which tyme ye erle of Surrey lorde admyral brent the tower of Morles in Britayne, & after landed at Caleys & entered Picardye, & brent townes & caſtels & beſieged Heſdinge, but by reaſon of wynter he rayſed his ſege & returned. This ſommer the duke of Albanye was entryng Englāde with a great army, but when he herd that therle of Shrewſbury was cōmynge to fyght with him, he toke a truce for ſyxe monethes.

Anno. do. M.ccccc.xxii. An. xiiii. H. viii Iohn̄ Mundy goldſmyth mayre. Iohn̄ Rudſtone. Iohn̄ Champneyes ſhirifs. ¶Chryſtierne kynge of Denmarke came in to Englande in Iune, & therle of ſurrey brent Iedworth and many other townes in Scotlande.
¶In this yere the Turke beſyeged the Rhodes, & vpō Chriſtmas day he toke it.
Anno do. M.ccccc.xxiii. An. xv. H. viii. Thomas Baldry mercer, mayre

Myghel Inglyſh. Nycolas Ienins, ſhir. ¶The duke of Suffolke wēt into Fraūce with .x.M. men, and paſſed the water of Some withoute battayle and toke & deſtroyed many towres, & in Decembre returned. The ſame yere the duke of Albany beſieged the Caſtel of Warke, & hearynge of the erle of Surryes commynge with a great armye, he cowardly fled.

Anno do. M.ccccc.xxiiii. An. xvi. H. viii. Wyllyam Bayly draper, mayre. Raufe Dodmer, Wylliam Roche, ſhyrifs. ¶This yere came frō themperour ye lord of Camphere & other lordes, & alſo out of Scotlande came the byſſhop of Dūkell & other as Embaſſadours, and on S. Mathias day was the frenche kynge taken. ¶ • mutyng in Norfolke & Suffolke for paymmēt of money. And a peace cōcluded bytwene Englande and Fraunce, and the Frenche kynge was delyuered in March. ¶This yere was the coyne enhaunced.
Anno do. M.ccccc.xxv. An. xvii. H. viii. Iohn̄ Aleyn mercer knyght, mayre.
Iohn̄ Cauton, Xp̄opher Aſcue, ſhyriffes.

Anno. M.ccccc.xxvi. An. xviii. H. viii. Thomas Seymer mercer knyght mayre. Stephan Pecok, Nycolas lambert, ſhir. ¶In this yere the Cytye of Rome, by the viceroy of Naples, and the duke of Burbone, the ſame duke beynge fyrſte kylled, was taken / and almoſt deſtroyed: and Clemens the .vii. than byſſhop of Rome, and dyuers of the cardynals there found, wer taken and broughte in to captyuytye, and vnder the rule of Charles the emperour. ¶This yere corne began to fayle. And the cardynall went in to Fraunce with great pompe, there he cōcluded a leage bytwene the king & the frenche king, which both defyed themperour, & ſēt one army into Italye / & in ſeptēbre he returned. And in october the greate maſter of Fraūce came in to London with greate tryumphe, for conluſion of the ſame leage.
Anno do. M.ccccc.xxvii. An. xix. H. viii. Iames Spencer vyntener, mayre.

Iohn̄ Hardye, Wyllyam Holleys, ſhirifs. ¶This yere corne was very dere, & had bene dearer yf marchauntes of ſtylyarde had not bene, & dutche ſhyps reſtreyned & an abſtinence of war betwene Englande & Flaunders. This yere was the ſweating ſykenes, for the which cauſe there was no watch at Mydſomer. On ſaynt Denyes day a legate came from Rome.
Anno do. M.ccccc.xxviij. An. xx. H. viii Iohn̄ Rudſtone draper mayre.
Rauf Waren. Iohn longe ſhirifs.
¶In Iune the Legates ſat at the blacke freers for the kynges maryage, & in October the Cardynall was depoſed of his chaūcellerſhyp, and peace betwene themperour and the kynge.
Anno do. M.ccccc.xxix. An. xxi. H. viii. Rauf Dodmer mercer mayre.
Myghel Dormer, Walter Chāpion. ſhir. ¶A parlyament for enormytyes of ye clergye. And themperour crowned at Boomye in Februarye.

Anno do. M.ccccc.xxx. An. xxii. H. viii. Thomas Pargetour ſalter knight maire William dauncy. Iohn Cloppinge ſhir. ¶The frenche kinges chyldrē delyuered. One boyled in ſmithfelde for poyſonyng. The cardynall dyed on ſ. andrewes euen.

Anno. do. M.ccccc.xxxi. An. xxiii. H. viij Nycolas Lamberd grocer knight mayre. Rychard Greſham. Edwarde Altam ſhir. ¶This yere the kynge began to buylde his palace at Weſtmynſtre. Griffith Ryſe beheded. In October the king went ouer the ſee & met with the frenche kinge.
Anno do. M.ccccc.xxxij. An. xxiiij. H. viij. Stephan Pecoke haberdaſſher knyghte, mayre. Rychard Raynolde, Rycharde Pynſon, Iohn Martyne ſhirifs.

¶This yere the kynge was by dew proces of the law dyuorced from lady katheryne his brothers wyfe and then he maryed lady An Bulleyn which was crowned quene on Whitſondaye. And on mydſomer
day dyed the frenche quene. And on ye euen of the Natyuytye of our ladye, was borne the lady Elyſabeth at Grenewyche.

Anno do. M.ccccc.xxxiii. An. xxv. H. viii. Xp̄opher Aſcue draper knyght, mayre. Wyllyam Forman, Thomas Kitſon, ſhir. ¶This yere one Wolfe & his wyfe were hanged for kyllynge of two marchauntes ſtraungers on the Themmes.
¶Alſo in Apryll was the Nunne called ye holy mayde of Kent, two monkes, & two freers hanged and heeded for treaſon, blaſphemye, and Hypocryſye.
¶A peace concluded with Scotlande.

Anno do. M.ccccc.xxxiiii. An. xxvi. H. viii. Iohn̄ Chāpneys ſkynner knyght, mayre. Nycolas Leueſō, Wylliam Denham ſhir. ¶This yere the erle of Kyldare dyed in ye tower, and his ſon rebelled and ſlewe the byſſhop of Dyuelyng, wherfore the kinge ſēt ſyr William Skeuymon thither T. his yere was graunted to the kynge the fyrſte frutes, & ye tēthes of al ſpiritual poſſeſſiōs.

In Iune was the byſſhop of Rocheſtre, & ſyr Tho. Moore beheded for denying the king to be ſupreme heed of ye church of Englande. And this yere were .iii. monkes of ye charterhouſe executed for ye ſame offēce.

Anno. M.ccccc.xxxv. An. xxvii. H. viii. Iohn̄ Aleyn meccer knyghte, the .ii. tyme mayr. Hūfrey Mōmouth, Io. Cotes, ſhir. ¶This yere in Ianuarye dyed lady Katheryne prynces dowayer, & is buryed at Peterborow. This yere was quene Anne attaynted of treaſon & beheded, & the kyng maryed lady Iane Seymer. And in october begā a folyſh comocyō ī Lyncolnſhyre, and an other in yorke ſhyre by the meanes of the lorde Darcye, ye lorde Huſey, ſyr Robart Conſtable, & Robart Aſke / which only by ye kinges wyſdō and his noble coūſel, were appeaced without bloodſheddynge.

Anno. M.ccccc.xxxvi. An. xxviii. H. viii. Syr Rauf Warren knyght, mayre. Rycharde Paget, Wyllyam Bower, ſhir. ¶The Thems ouer froſen in Decembre
wherfore ye king & the quene rode through London with a goodly cōpany. Syr fraū ces Bygot, ye lorde Darcy, ſyr Robart Conſtable & other begā a new cōſpiracy, whiche were attaynted, & put to deth in Iune. ¶In February was Thomas FitzGarred & .v. of his vncles hanged, drawen, and quartred. And on ſ. Edwardes euen was borne at Hampton court prince Edward.
The .xxiiii. daye of October dyed quene Iane, and is buryed at wynſore.

Anno. M.ccccc.xxxvii. An. xxix. H. viii. Syr Rycharde Greſſham knyght, mayre. Iohn̄ Greſſham, Thomas Lewē / ſher. ¶In May was frere Foreſt hanged and brent in ſmythfelde for treaſon & hereſye. And this yere all ydolatry was forbyddē, & dyuers ymages that had Ingynnes to make theyr eyen opē & ſhut, & many other falſe iuglinges deſtroyed, & all freers and monkes chaunged theyr garmentes.
Anno. M.ccccc.xxxviii. An. xxx. H. viii. Syr wyllyam Forman mayre.

Williā Wylkynſon Nycolas gybſon. ſhir.
¶This yere in Decembre was the Marques of Exceſtre, the lorde Mountacute, & ſir Edwarde Neuel beheded for hygh treaſon duly ꝓued. And in Maye the cytizins of London muſtered all in whyt harnys & cotes of whyte ſylke and white cloth, with chaynes of golde, in thre greate battayles, to the greate wonder of ſtraungers.

Anno do. M.ccccc.xxxix. An. xxxi. H. viii. Syr Wyllyam Holleys knyght, mayre. Iohn̄ Fayry, Thomas Huntlowe, ſhir. ¶In Nouēbre were thabbots of Redīg, Glaſtenbury, and Colcheſtre attaynted of high treaſon, & like traytours put to deth. ☞In Ianuarye was receyued wt greate tryūph the noble lady Anne, ſiſter to Wyllyam duke of Cleue, Iulyers, Gelders, & Berge, and maryed to the kynge our ſoueraygne lorde, to whome God ſend long lyfe togyther with moche procreacion, & long cotynuaunce of theyr iſſue. Amen.
¶Imprynted at London in Fleteſtrete, at the ſigne of the Sonne, by Iohn Byddell.
